title: Microstructural Effects of Cerium Oxide Nanoparticles Obtained by the Hydrothermal Route: HRTEM and XRD Analysis
content: The microstructural effects of cerium oxide nanoparticles (CeO2-NPs) such as average apparent size, shape, and distribution have been considered important parameters for coating against corrosion, catalysis, and gas sensor applications [1]. High-resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM) in combination with the analysis of the broadening of the X-ray diffraction (XRD) peaks using the FullProf software are tools that allow for monitoring of these microstructural effects [2]. To the best of our knowledge no reports of the microstructural effects based on the spherical harmonics (SH) coefficients refinement in combination with TEM images considering CeO2-NPs have been published. Then, it is necessary to further monitor the structural features (XRD), morphology, and size (HRTEM) of CeO2-NPs as a potential reinforcement material for mechanical applications. The motivation of this work is to synthesize CeO2-NPs using the hydrothermal route to monitor these microstructural effects.
